Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pentadactylin (Ocellatin-P1, natural AMPs; XXA; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: South American bullfrog,Leptodactylus pentadactylus, skin secretion,Leptodactylus labyrinthicus

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Also isolated from Leptodactylus labyrinthicus (Lib√©rio et al., 2011). Found in multiple species.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 25 uM), E. cloacae HNTCC 53001 (MIC 50 uM), Streptococcus Group B HNTCC 80130 (MIC 50 uM), K. pneumoniae KK3 9904 (MIC 100 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 100 uM), S. epidermidis RP62A (MIC 100 uM).Anticancer: killed the murine melanoma cell line B16F10 (IC50 25.7 uM).Toxicity: also toxic to normal human fibroblast cells (IC50 35.9 uM).Updated 5/2020; 2/2024
Literature Information.Author: King JD, Al-Ghaferi N, Abraham B, Sonnevend A, Leprince J, Nielsen PF, Conlon JM2005
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol C Toxicol Pharmacol. 2005 Aug;141(4):393-7.
Literature Information.Title: Pentadactylin: an antimicrobial peptide from the skin secretions of the South American bullfrog Leptodactylus pentadactylus
